      boolean checkDateFormat(java.lang.String _date)
      This method checks and validates if the integer passed is in the format of ddMMyy

      This method checks and validates if the integer passed is in the format of dd/MM/yyyy
      int compareDate(java.lang.String _date)
      This method compares 2 dates, TODAY and FUTURE This method enables flexiAdd() to determine the number of days between dates in order to process the result

      Usage: (example based on TODAY's Date = 2014-11-01)

      compareDate("2014-11-03") > 2 compareDate("2014-11-20") > 19
      java.lang.String compareDateTime(java.lang.String date_begin, java.lang.String date_end) 
      java.lang.String convertDateFormat(java.lang.String _date)
      This method is the same as getDateInFormat except it's parsed format is different FUTURE Date is parsed from exactDate() which will return exactly the format of yyyy-MM-dd

      Usage:

      convertDateFormat("2014-11-09"); > 2014-11-09 convertDateFormat("2014-11-23T14:30"); > 2014-11-23 convertDateFormat("2014-11-11-WXX-2"); > 2011-11-11 convertDateFormat("2014-11-18-WXX-2T10:00"); > 2014-11-18
      java.lang.String determinePriority(java.lang.String _date)
      This method determines the priority of a task based on natural processing This artificial natural processing calculates the days difference

      The priority is determined by the number of weeks apart from today's date The current rule of this determiner decreases the priority each week from today's date The closer the date is to today's date holds the highest priority and decreases each week

      Assumptions: 1.
      java.lang.String[] extractDate(java.lang.String _date)
      This method extracts the date based on the format of yyyy-MM-dd This will return an Array of String results containing DAY, MONTH, YEAR

      Usage:

      extractDate("2014-11-09"); > [09, 11, 2014] extractDate("2014-11-23T14:30"); > [23, 11, 2014] extractDate("2014-11-11-WXX-2"); > [11, 11, 2014] extractDate("2014-11-18-WXX-2T10:00"); > [18, 11, 2014]

      Usage:

      genericDateFormat("2014-11-09"); > 091114

      • convertDateFormat

        public java.lang.String convertDateFormat(java.lang.String _date)
                                   throws java.text.ParseException
        This method is the same as getDateInFormat except it's parsed format is different FUTURE Date is parsed from exactDate() which will return exactly the format of yyyy-MM-dd

        Usage:

        convertDateFormat("2014-11-09"); > 2014-11-09 convertDateFormat("2014-11-23T14:30"); > 2014-11-23 convertDateFormat("2014-11-11-WXX-2"); > 2011-11-11 convertDateFormat("2014-11-18-WXX-2T10:00"); > 2014-11-18

        Parameters:
        _date -
        Returns:
        _result
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException

      • validateDate

        public java.lang.String validateDate(java.lang.String _date)
        This method validates the date and parse to the following format (ddMMyy) This works for general cases where the day difference is more than 2 days. This method is similar to getDateInFormat

        Usage: validateDate("2014-11-18-WXX-2T10:00"); > 181114

        Parameters:
        _date -
        Returns:

      • getTimeInFormat

        public java.lang.String getTimeInFormat(java.lang.String _time)
                                 throws java.text.ParseException
        This method validates the time and parse to the following format (hh:mm) This will return the time from the given string in the format of hh:mm

        Usage:

        getTimeInFormat("10:30"); > 10:30 getTimeInFormat("2014-11-23T14:30"); > 14:30 getTimeInFormat("2014-11-18-WXX-2T10:00"); > 10:00

        Parameters:
        _time -
        Returns:
        _result
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException

      • validateTime

        public java.lang.String validateTime(java.lang.String _time)
        This method validates the token from NLP SUTIME Annotation based on our predefined regex expression This method is parsed to get the time only

        Usage:

        validateTime("2014-11-18-WXX-2T10:00"); > 10:00 validateTime("2014-11-18-WXX-2T10:00"); > 10:00

        Parameters:
        _time -
        Returns:

        Validate date format with regular expression
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true valid date format, false invalid date format

      • fixShortDate

        public java.lang.String fixShortDate(java.lang.String _date)
                              throws java.text.ParseException
        This method will check if date matches dd/MM/yyyy. The algorithm converts that into readable date of format yyyy-MM-dd

        Usage:

        fixShortDate("01/11/2014"); > 2014-11-01 fixShortDate("32/11/2014"); > 2014-12-2 (Exception case, automatically calculate date forward)

        Parameters:
        _date -
        Returns:
        _result
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException

                              throws java.text.ParseException
        This method will check if date matches ddMMyy. The algorithm converts that into readable date of format yyyy-MM-dd

        Usage:

        nlpShortDate("011214"); > 2014-12-01

        Returns:
        _result

      • extractDate

        public java.lang.String[] extractDate(java.lang.String _date)
                               throws java.text.ParseException
        This method extracts the date based on the format of yyyy-MM-dd This will return an Array of String results containing DAY, MONTH, YEAR

        Usage:

        extractDate("2014-11-09"); > [09, 11, 2014] extractDate("2014-11-23T14:30"); > [23, 11, 2014] extractDate("2014-11-11-WXX-2"); > [11, 11, 2014] extractDate("2014-11-18-WXX-2T10:00"); > [18, 11, 2014]

        Parameters:
        _date -
        Returns:
        _list
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException

      • determinePriority

        public java.lang.String determinePriority(java.lang.String _date)
                                   throws java.text.ParseException
        This method determines the priority of a task based on natural processing This artificial natural processing calculates the days difference

        The priority is determined by the number of weeks apart from today's date The current rule of this determiner decreases the priority each week from today's date The closer the date is to today's date holds the highest priority and decreases each week

        Assumptions: 1. User can override the priority based on their preferred choice 2. Priority is set based on this determiner algorithm, may not accurately reflect user's intentions 3. Priority range from 1 - 9. 1 represents the least of priority, 9 represents the most urgent of priority

        The higher the priority the more urgent the task is The default priority is set to '2'

        Usage: (example based on TODAY's Date = 2014-11-01)

        determinePriority("2014-11-08") > 9 determinePriority("2014-11-20") > 8 determinePriority("2014-11-23") > 7 determinePriority("2014-12-07") > 5

        Parameters:
        _date -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException

      • compareDate

        public int compareDate(java.lang.String _date)
                throws java.text.ParseException
        This method compares 2 dates, TODAY and FUTURE This method enables flexiAdd() to determine the number of days between dates in order to process the result

        Usage: (example based on TODAY's Date = 2014-11-01)

        compareDate("2014-11-03") > 2 compareDate("2014-11-20") > 19

        Parameters:
        _date -
        Returns:
        num_days
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException

        Returns:
